summary: The Leveraging Integrity and Verification of Eligibility for Beneficiaries Act (LIVE Beneficiaries Act) amends Title XIX of the Social Security Act to require states to quarterly verify the enrollment status of individuals receiving medical assistance. States must review the Death Master File to identify deceased enrollees and disenroll them, ceasing payments. It allows for reinstatement if an error occurs. The bill aims to prevent improper payments and improve the accuracy of Medicaid enrollment.
